# Steps to reproduce
```powershell

1. Turn on Caps Lock
2. Start typing some letters with shift key pressed down.
```

# Expected behavior

```none
Letters should appear in lower case form
```

# Actual behavior

```none
Nothing appears, just cursor blinking
```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: anmenaga
comments.body:
I can repro on `PSVersion = 6.2.1`
Does Not repro on `PSVersion = 7.0.0-preview.1`

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
@kumold what version of PSReadLine are you using?  Run:

```powershell
(gmo psreadline).privatedata.psdata
```

If it shows anything older than beta4.  Try installing 2.0.0-beta4:

```powershell
install-module psreadline -allowprerelease -force
```

comments.author: kumold
comments.body: Updating PSReadLine did solve the issue.

title: Nothing is typing when using shift while caps lock is on
